description.value:
Trigger A creature approaches within 10 feet of one of the time rifts

Effect The triggering creature takes [[/r 1d12[electricity]]] damage (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true] save). The overloading arch rolls initiative.

details.description: The Eternity Arch sparks with electricity, releasing bolts of lightning at each of the four largest time rifts.
details.disable: @Check[type:thievery|dc:30] (expert) or @Check[type:arcana|dc:28], @Check[type:nature|dc:28], @Check[type:occultism|dc:28], or @Check[type:religion|dc:28] (expert) to seal each of the four time rifts, @Check[type:crafting|dc:30] (trained) to divert the lightning to another source, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Dispel Magic]{Dispel Magic} (4th level; counteract DC 26) to counteract each time rift.
details.routine: (4 actions) The trap loses 1 action each turn for each disabled time rift. On each of the trap's actions, the Eternity Arch releases a bolt of lightning that activates that rift, dealing [[/r 2d12[electricity]]] damage to all creatures in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:10] around the time rift (@Check[type:reflex|dc:28|basic:true] save). It can release a bolt at each active time rift no more than once each turn.

source.value: Pathfinder Society Special #3-99: Fate in the Future
